attributes.action: Remove the unfair 'tax on tax' treatment of Stamp Duty liability being struck after the addition of any VAT on property purchase.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: It seems an unfair anomaly of the Stamp Duty legislation that if I purchase a property for £250,000 that is not subject to VAT, I pay 1% Stamp Duty i.e. £2500 - but if that property is subject to VAT not only do I pay my Stamp Duty on the gross price of £293750, but also - in this example - I have to pay it at 3% because it takes me into the next band i.e. £8812. In other words, in this example, I have paid an additional £6312 (or more than three times the original £2500) in Stamp Duty merely because the property I purchased was subject to VAT.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
